timeline.bodyText: What is this method supposed to do? There's no feature "name" associated to a DAnnotation.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: This is used for the name of the cell block.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

replies.bodyText:
Sorry I was not clear.
setDataValue(semanticElement, ModellingcorePackage.eINSTANCE.getAbstractNamedElement_Name(), ""); is not necessary here. semanticElement is a DAnnotation which does not take part in the ModellingcorePackage and does not have a name.
replies.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.bodyText: Content field?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.bodyText: To test in collaborative mode to see if the cell is locked when being modifed by someone else.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.bodyText: Could you extract this code into a method to avoid code duplication?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.bodyText: Could you extract Keywords like "TB" into constants with meaningful name so that it's easier to maintain the code?
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.bodyText: Same remark as above for cell names.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

timeline.bodyText: This method is called for KeyPressed events which makes the expression evaluated for each key press. This can cause performance issue and not really necessary. Focus lost event should be good.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: I added this because focus listener seems to have some problems. This problem is also present for example for PropertyValue. If you complete the Name and then complete Summary and then click somewhere on the screen, then if you go back to PropertyValue, the Summary is not saved. This appears to be because focus lost and focus gained are not called when they should.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: As I observe, this is evaluated on the graphical elements but not the semantic elements. For example, typing feature:summary on a cell of a title block linked to a class does not show anything though a class does have a summary.
timeline.author: minhtutonthat

replies.bodyText: It appears that is actually working.
replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

replies.bodyText: There's a little bug when the element does not have the feature (e.g. summary), the cell shows some weird elements...
replies.author: minhtutonthat

replies.author: Cosmin-Visan

timeline.bodyText: It if is an element title block, it will reference also the semantic element so lines = lines = 1.
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

timeline.bodyText: before doing EObject obj = titleBlock.getReferences().get(1), check that titleBlock.getReferences().size() > 1
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

timeline.bodyText: create getAvailableDiagramTitleBlocks and another one getAvailableElementTitleBlocks. Instead of TITLE_BLOCK use DIAGRAM_TITLE_BLOCK and ELEMENT_TITLE_BLOCK.
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

timeline.bodyText: same remark as for getAvailableTitleBlocks, create 2 functions one for Diagram TB one for Element TB.
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

timeline.bodyText: also here, create one function for diagram TB and one for element TB.
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

timeline.bodyText: do not hardcode mapping.
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

timeline.bodyText: insetad of TITLE_BLOCK use DIAGRAM_TITLE_BLOCK.
timeline.author: georgiana-ecobici

timeline.bodyText: instead of TITLE_BLOCK use ELEMENT_TITLE_BLOCK.
